pr_title: feat(broker): a job worker is optional

timeline.bodyText: Not sure this is useful, can you explain when someone would want this log message?
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText:
I'm thinking about this part from the issue(#5819):

we should also accept that it is absent on the broker side and simply log the client as anonymous.

So, did I add this logging in the wrong place? :)
replies.author: aivinog1

replies.bodyText:
Ah, sorry - I know we used to log the worker during activation. I meant here wherever we are logging the name, we should just log anonymous if there is no name. If we had no logging anywhere related to this then that's fine, just ignore it 🙂
So here we could remove this entirely
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText:
I think it's fine to not test these things - we already have tests covering this. Rule of thumb is to have many tests, each asserting as little as possible (the ideal is one assertion per test, but obviously that's not always possible). So in this case, what is our test covering? What are the things that we really need to assert?
I would argue only care that one job was activated, and that its worker is nothing. The rest isn't important.
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: I agree, will fix that. By the way, what do you think about parameterized tests? We can simply reuse some tests that already exist, but with different worker name.
replies.author: aivinog1

replies.bodyText: I decided to not use parameterized tests in that case. I removed unnecessary parts.
replies.author: aivinog1

replies.bodyText: We'll be refactoring parts of the engine and how we process job, so I imagine some of the tests will change - best not to modify too much now 🙂
replies.author: npepinpe
